lead_paragraph: Across the Valencia region, about 50 indicted politicians are hoping to win re-election on Sunday, even as they prepare to appear before courts.

headline.print_headline: Spain’s Many Indicted Politicians Undercut ‘Red Line’ Against Graft
headline.main: Spain’s Many Indicted Politicians Undercut ‘Red Line’ Against Graft

snippet: Across the Valencia region, about 50 indicted politicians are hoping to win re-election on Sunday, even as they prepare to appear before courts.
abstract: Regional and local election results in Valencia, Spain, stronghold of Populist Party leader Alberto Fabra and Prime Min Mariano Rajoy, are being watched to measure how sensitive voters are to anticorruption campaign led by insurgent party; Valencia is regarded as bellwether of Rajoy's own chances of winning again later on in year; Fabra pledged to keep politicians indicted for corruption from running but around 50 indicted politicians are campaigning for re-election.
